q: 1924 and later moving to los angeles, Earl Palmer worked extensively in both cities, recording with some of the music world's all-time greats on thousands of tracks. his beats form the backdrop on ike and Tina Turner 's river deep, mountain high, Fats Domino 's and "i hear you knockin" ' by smiley lewis. from his los angeles home, Earl Palmer drummed for music producer Phil Spector and motown, and his session credits include artists as diverse as the
